cards.title: Nepal's second earthquake captured on video by relief workers
cards.rawTitle: Nepal's second earthquake captured on video by relief workers

item.title: Nepal's second earthquake captured on video by relief workers
item.trailText: International members of the aid organisation All Hands Volunteers currently based in Kathmandu capture the moments after a major earthquake hits Nepal
item.standFirst: International members of the aid organisation All Hands Volunteers currently based in Kathmandu capture the moments after a major earthquake hits Nepal. It had a magnitude of 7.3 and struck close to Mount Everest. Hundreds are feared dead after this second quake, coming just weeks after the disaster that killed more than 8,000 people

stillImage.caption: All Hands Volunteer's Chloe Lyttle in Kathmandu after second earthquake. 12 May 2015 Photograph: Chloe Lyttle Photograph: Chloe Lyttle
stillImage.cleanCaption: All Hands Volunteer's Chloe Lyttle in Kathmandu after second earthquake. 12 May 2015 Photograph: Chloe Lyttle

displayImages.cleanCaption: All Hands Volunteer's Chloe Lyttle in Kathmandu after second earthquake. 12 May 2015 Photograph: Chloe Lyttle

cards.title: Andre Kertész / Kingpin of European photography

item.title: Andre Kertész, kingpin of European photography
item.trailText: From severed legs in 1920s Paris to a London flea market in the 80s, via Henry Moore’s elephant skull and Cecil Beaton’s desk, a new show of the Hungarian legend’s work – the first to focus solely on his European photography – spans 60 years and is full of never-before-seen shots
item.standFirst:
From severed legs in 1920s Paris to a London flea market in the 80s, via Henry Moore’s elephant skull and Cecil Beaton’s desk, a new show of the Hungarian legend’s work – the first to focus solely on his European photography – spans 60 years and is full of never-before-seen shots

  • Andre Kertész in Europe is at the James Hyman gallery, London to 13 June

cards.title: Goodfellas to Ghost / A movie scout's favourite New York City film locations
cards.rawTitle: A movie scout's favourite New York City film locations

item.title: Goodfellas to Ghost: a movie scout's favourite New York City film locations
item.trailText: Classic diners, fake benches and a car chase scene you’d never get permission to shoot today... location scout Nick Carr tours us around his favourite uses of New York City in the movies
item.standFirst:
Classic diners, fake benches and a car chase scene you’d never get permission to shoot today... location scout Nick Carr tours us around his favourite uses of New York City in the movies

  • Confessions of a location scout: why the New York beloved of the movies doesn’t exist any more

displayImages.caption:
The French Connection: Stillwell Ave, 86th Street and New Utrecht Ave
The French Connection is filled with incredible locations from a bygone ‘gritty’ New York, but nothing beats the extended elevated-train car chase through south Brooklyn. It hurts to think of how many permits you’d need to do anything remotely similar today
 Photograph: Ronald Grant Archive
displayImages.altText: The French Connection Stillwell Ave/86th Street/New Utrecht Ave Extended elevated-train car chase through south Brooklyn
displayImages.cleanCaption:
The French Connection: Stillwell Ave, 86th Street and New Utrecht Ave
The French Connection is filled with incredible locations from a bygone ‘gritty’ New York, but nothing beats the extended elevated-train car chase through south Brooklyn. It hurts to think of how many permits you’d need to do anything remotely similar today

displayImages.caption:
Goodfellas: diner at 69-35 Astoria Boulevard, Queens
What better place to learn your best friend is planning to kill you than an all-American diner? This classic greasy spoon in Jackson Heights, Queens continues to serve as a popular filming location, most recently for Blue Bloods, Person of Interest, and You Don’t Know Jack Photograph: Warner Bros/Everett/Rex Features
displayImages.altText: Goodfellas Diner - 69-35 Astoria Boulevard, Queens Classic greasy spoon in Jackson Heights, Queens – scene in which Ray Liotta and Robert De Niro are sitting at the table
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Goodfellas: diner at 69-35 Astoria Boulevard, Queens
What better place to learn your best friend is planning to kill you than an all-American diner? This classic greasy spoon in Jackson Heights, Queens continues to serve as a popular filming location, most recently for Blue Bloods, Person of Interest, and You Don’t Know Jack

displayImages.caption:
Manhattan: Sutton Place – Queensboro Bridge
With just a bench and a bridge, Woody Allen managed to create one of the most romantic shots in film history. But don’t go to Sutton Place hoping to recreate the scene – the bench, most likely a movie prop, doesn’t actually exist Photograph: Allstar Collection/Cinetext/UNIT
displayImages.altText:
Manhattan: Sutton Place – Queensboro Bridge
With just a bench and a bridge, Woody Allen managed to create one of the most romantic shots in film history. But don’t go to Sutton Place hoping to recreate the scene – the bench, most likely a movie prop, doesn’t actually exist
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Manhattan: Sutton Place – Queensboro Bridge
With just a bench and a bridge, Woody Allen managed to create one of the most romantic shots in film history. But don’t go to Sutton Place hoping to recreate the scene – the bench, most likely a movie prop, doesn’t actually exist

displayImages.caption:
The Warriors, etc: Hoyt-Schermerhorn subway station
The decommissioned Hoyt-Schermerhorn platform continues its second life as a wonderful film shoot location, used in everything from The Warriors to Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles to Michael Jackson’s Bad to 2009’s remake of The Taking of Pelham 1-2-3. When filming on live subway tracks, all production crew members are required to undergo safety training certification by the MTA, which includes lessons on crossing the third rail and how to avoid an oncoming train Photograph: Astrid Stawiarz/Getty Images
displayImages.altText:
The Warriors, etc: Hoyt-Schermerhorn subway station
The decommissioned Hoyt-Schermerhorn platform continues its second life as a wonderful film shoot location, used in everything from The Warriors to Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles to Michael Jackson’s Bad to 2009’s remake of The Taking of Pelham 1-2-3. When filming on live subway tracks, all production crew members are required to undergo safety training certification by the MTA, which includes lessons on crossing the third rail and how to avoid an oncoming train
displayImages.cleanCaption:
The Warriors, etc: Hoyt-Schermerhorn subway station
The decommissioned Hoyt-Schermerhorn platform continues its second life as a wonderful film shoot location, used in everything from The Warriors to Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles to Michael Jackson’s Bad to 2009’s remake of The Taking of Pelham 1-2-3. When filming on live subway tracks, all production crew members are required to undergo safety training certification by the MTA, which includes lessons on crossing the third rail and how to avoid an oncoming train

displayImages.caption:
The Godfather: 128 Mott Street
The Little Italy home of the Corleone family’s Genco Olive Oil business. The Don (Marlon Brando, centre) was shot just in front of the entrance. Brando is pictured here with director Francis Ford Coppola (right) and producer Al Ruddy (left). Today, it houses a Chinese market, the street now a part of Chinatown Photograph: Ronald Grant Archive
displayImages.altText:
The Godfather: 128 Mott Street
The Little Italy home of the Corleone family’s Genco Olive Oil business. The Don (Marlon Brando, centre) was shot just in front of the entrance. Brando is pictured here with director Francis Ford Coppola (right) and producer Al Ruddy (left). Today, it houses a Chinese market, the street now a part of Chinatown
displayImages.cleanCaption:
The Godfather: 128 Mott Street
The Little Italy home of the Corleone family’s Genco Olive Oil business. The Don (Marlon Brando, centre) was shot just in front of the entrance. Brando is pictured here with director Francis Ford Coppola (right) and producer Al Ruddy (left). Today, it houses a Chinese market, the street now a part of Chinatown

displayImages.caption:
North By Northwest: United Nations Building
Permission is never granted to film at the UN building – but that didn’t stop Alfred Hitchcock, who hid his camera inside a bread truck as Cary Grant casually walked up the stairs past oblivious guards. The interiors were recreated on a soundstage Photograph: Paul Almasy/Corbis
displayImages.altText:
North By Northwest: United Nations Building
Permission is never granted to film at the UN building – but that didn’t stop Alfred Hitchcock, who hid his camera inside a bread truck as Cary Grant casually walked up the stairs past oblivious guards. The interiors were recreated on a soundstage
displayImages.cleanCaption:
North By Northwest: United Nations Building
Permission is never granted to film at the UN building – but that didn’t stop Alfred Hitchcock, who hid his camera inside a bread truck as Cary Grant casually walked up the stairs past oblivious guards. The interiors were recreated on a soundstage

displayImages.caption:
The Apartment: bench at West Drive near 67th Street, Central Park
A sick Jack Lemon huddles for warmth on a Central Park bench on a cold, rainy night while his boss uses his apartment for a fling. The endless line of benches perfectly underscores his loneliness Photograph: United Archives GmbH / Alamy/Alamy
displayImages.altText: The Apartment Bench - West Drive near 67th Street, Central Park A sick Jack Lemon huddles for warmth on a Central Park bench on a cold, rainy night while his boss uses his apartment for a fling. The endless line of benches perfectly emphasizes his loneliness.
displayImages.cleanCaption:
The Apartment: bench at West Drive near 67th Street, Central Park
A sick Jack Lemon huddles for warmth on a Central Park bench on a cold, rainy night while his boss uses his apartment for a fling. The endless line of benches perfectly underscores his loneliness

displayImages.caption:
Ghostbusters: 55 Central Park West
Dana Barrett (Sigourney Weaver)’s apartment building, where the climax of Ghostbusters takes place, is a beautiful art deco masterpiece along Central Park West. Though it wasn’t tall enough for the scene as written, special effects were used to add a few dozen floors, along with an iconic temple roofcap Photograph: Eric Nathan/Alamy
displayImages.altText: Ghostbusters 55 Central Park West Dana Barrett’s apartment building is a beautiful art deco masterpiece along Central Park West
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Ghostbusters: 55 Central Park West
Dana Barrett (Sigourney Weaver)’s apartment building, where the climax of Ghostbusters takes place, is a beautiful art deco masterpiece along Central Park West. Though it wasn’t tall enough for the scene as written, special effects were used to add a few dozen floors, along with an iconic temple roofcap

displayImages.caption:
Taxi Driver: 8th Avenue & 47th Street
With a shot of Travis Bickle walking down a derelict 8th Avenue lined by adult cinemas, Martin Scorsese brilliantly uses a single location to define his entire film. The porno theatre is now a Gray Line tourist bus stop Photograph: Granamour Weems Collection/Alamy
displayImages.altText: Taxi Driver, 8th Avenue & 47th Street
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Taxi Driver: 8th Avenue & 47th Street
With a shot of Travis Bickle walking down a derelict 8th Avenue lined by adult cinemas, Martin Scorsese brilliantly uses a single location to define his entire film. The porno theatre is now a Gray Line tourist bus stop

displayImages.caption:
Ghost: Crosby Street between Prince & Spring
A normally pleasant, cobble-stoned byway in Soho takes on a dangerous feel in Ghost as Patrick Swayze’s character is gunned down in a robbery gone wrong. At the time, it might have been down-and-out; today, no one would believe it Photograph: Ronald Grant Archive
displayImages.altText: Ghost Crosby Street btw. Prince & Spring A normally pleasant, cobble-stoned byway in Soho takes on a dangerous feel in Ghost as  Patrick Swayze’s character is gun downed in a robbery gone wrong
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Ghost: Crosby Street between Prince & Spring
A normally pleasant, cobble-stoned byway in Soho takes on a dangerous feel in Ghost as Patrick Swayze’s character is gunned down in a robbery gone wrong. At the time, it might have been down-and-out; today, no one would believe it

displayImages.caption:
Do the Right Thing: pizzeria at Lexington Ave & Stuyvesant Street
I don’t think there’s a better example of a movie fully encapsulating a New York City neighbourhood than Do The Right Thing – even though the pizza shop itself was fake, the genuine character of the neighbourhood permeates Spike Lee’s masterpiece
 Photograph: Allstar/Cinetext/MCA/Universal
displayImages.altText: Do The Right Thing Pizza Shop - Lexington Ave & Stuyvesant Street
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Do the Right Thing: pizzeria at Lexington Ave & Stuyvesant Street
I don’t think there’s a better example of a movie fully encapsulating a New York City neighbourhood than Do The Right Thing – even though the pizza shop itself was fake, the genuine character of the neighbourhood permeates Spike Lee’s masterpiece

cards.title: The town that took off / Laurent Chehere's flying houses

item.title: The town that took off: Laurent Chehere's flying houses
item.trailText: Homes, hotels, caravans, circus tops – even the peeping toms have taken flight in Laurent Chehere’s gorgeous photographs of structures suspended mid-sky. It’s time to go up, up and away
item.standFirst: Homes, hotels, caravans, circus tops – even the peeping toms have taken flight in Laurent Chehere’s gorgeous photographs of structures suspended mid-sky. It’s time to go up, up and away

cards.title: 'In 10 years British basketball will be a major sport'
cards.rawTitle: 'In 10 years British basketball will be a major sport'

item.title: 'In 10 years British basketball will be a major sport'
item.trailText: Some of the sport's most influential names address the lack of funding in the UK, the standard of play and assess basketball's future
item.standFirst: The British Basketball League has been the benchmark for professional basketball in the UK since 1987. It has seen multiple teams fold and sponsors come and go, but 2015 sees the sport firmly on the up with the signature event, the playoff final, now played in front of 15,000 people at the O2 Arena. Here, some of the sport's most influential names address the lack of funding, the standard of play and assess basketball's future

cards.title: Blooms around the world / Readers' cherry blossom pictures

item.title: Blooms around the world: readers' cherry blossom pictures
item.trailText: The trees have bloomed and we asked you for your most striking images from this year’s cherry blossom season. Here are some of our favourites
item.standFirst:

  • You can see all the contributions on GuardianWitness

cards.title: Attack of the clones? / Star Wars exhibition previews at Madame Tussauds
cards.rawTitle: Star Wars exhibition previews at Madame Tussauds

item.title: Star Wars exhibition previews at Madame Tussauds
item.trailText: Madam Tussauds previews its Star Wars exhibition ahead of the new film Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens
item.standFirst: Madam Tussauds previews its Star Wars exhibition ahead of the new film Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens, due to be released in December. The museum has a series of classic scenes from the films, including Luke Skywalker's battle with Darth Vader and Jabba the Hut. The exhibition is due to open on 16 May
